sub section 1.1: In Q1 2021, TSMC reported revenue of approximately TWD 362.4 billion (USD 12.9 billion), which represented a sequential increase of 0.2% in NT dollars and 1.9% in U.S. dollars. The growth was mainly driven by strong demand in high-performance computing (HPC), despite a milder smartphone seasonality. The quarter saw some challenges which led to a decrease in gross margin by 1.6 percentage points to 52.4%, and operating margin decreased by 2 percentage points to 41.5%. The full-year guidance indicated a revenue growth of around 20% based on ongoing strong demand across various applications including potential price adjustments.

sub section 1.2: Data on wafer sales for TSMC in Q1 2021 is less explicit. However, the overall sales were supported largely by HPC-related demands, with advanced technologies (7nm and below) accounting for 49% of wafer revenue. Further breakdown on specific quantities and average selling prices (ASP) was not available.

sub section 2.2: Specific sales guidance or forecast by segment for Q2 2021 or the full year was not articulated clearly.
